website_summaries.verdict: A deluxe French press for discerning coffee lovers and gourmets alike. The best on the market.
pros: Durable, long-lasting appliance favored by coffee aficionados
cons: On the pricier end of the spectrum

customer_reviews.title: sad, but hoping for a  better experience on my next attempt...
customer_reviews.text: I would like to note that I have already purchased a replacement press (same make/model) as I'm hoping that this issue is a isolated one. The problem with the press I received was that the handle wasn't fully welded to the press itself... the handle was practically hanging off of the little bar that connects to the main body of the press. I'm hoping the replacement press doesn't have any quality issues, as I really to like the design of the press as a whole.
customer_reviews.author: andrew margin

customer_reviews.title: Broke and unusable after 2 months!
customer_reviews.text: VERY disappointed in the quality of this French press. The stem broke this morning rendering this unusable. Hoping the company will stand by their product and either send me a new plunger or replace this item. Still have to go buy a new one until then and will go back to the tried and true glass Chambord, even if I do keep breaking them.
customer_reviews.author: lizzyb

customer_reviews.title: Metallic tasting coffee
customer_reviews.text: Originally loved it, but after the second day the coffee had a strong metallic taste. Returning and going to try the polish version.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Water inside the wall of my beautiful, double walled french Press.
customer_reviews.text: I received this on July 11, 2017 and today Is August 12, 2017, not but 2 days after the return window was closed. I have been noticing that the pot was getting hot on the outside wall leading me to think that it was not double walled as advertised. Today, as I was drying after washing it, I noted the sound of trapped water. Do not see a leak site and this item is never submerged in water. It is beautiful and I love to see it as it greets me in the morning ready to make my first cup. I am hoping that 2 days will not make a difference to my return.
customer_reviews.author: Whitney

customer_reviews.title: Loved it for 7 months UNTIL the screw stripped!
customer_reviews.text: I bought my Frieling French press last July and loved it - until 2 days ago when I found the screw attachment for the mesh filters has stripped. So, I can't pull the filters out anymore without using another tool to do so. I even ordered a second press for my father-in-law in November because he too loved the coffee we made with it. I've been careful not to over tighten the mechanism and never expected this would happen with such a highly rated press. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: I Betanc

customer_reviews.title: Good Stainless Steel
customer_reviews.text: This is a stainless steel French press, great for avoiding having plastic "sweat" into your hot coffee every morning. Unfortunately made in China, but so are all the other options. Inspect the press carefully when you receive it! The first one I got had weird drippy-looking metal on the bottom of the filters. (I've noticed that items ordered through this site sometimes have a "fell off the back of a truck" quality to them so I knew to be on the lookout for defects.) I ordered another one from a different site, and it is great! Perfect cup of coffee with minimal sediment. Easy to throw in the dishwasher.
customer_reviews.author: Fipling

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful and durable French press
customer_reviews.text: I love the look and feel of this French press, and love that it is stainless steel and not breakable and no plastic exposure. I throw it in a bag to carry out to our farm (then bring back on Sunday evening) and feel pretty sure I will be using it for years My main issue with it is that if you put a little too much water into it, it can spurt out the spout (nothing keeps it from coming out ) Overa beautiful and durable (although I have been using only a month)
customer_reviews.author: Sabrina L. Schrader

customer_reviews.title: Love it. Not great for more acidic roasts.
customer_reviews.text: After breaking about 5 glass French presses over the past few years, I decided to give this stainless steel one a try. I love how it looks and it’s built very solidly. The only downside I’ve noticed is if I brew a more acidic coffee in it there is a slight metallic taste. I have solved this problem by sticking to French roast coffee. I don’t use the second fine mesh filter screen because I like a little more sediment in my coffee. Overall I prefer this to the several other French presses I’ve owned because it looks great, I know I’m not going to break it, and it does the job.
customer_reviews.author: Ken in L.A.

customer_reviews.title: Handsome and makes delicious coffee.
customer_reviews.text: After a fairly traumatic experience with my Keurig and what had to be hundreds of little black ants, I looked for an alternative route to morning coffe satisfaction. I wanted something simple, easy to clean and completely inhospitable to the aforementioned little black ants. This is just that. And, after a little experimentation, I have two perfect, tasty and pristine large mugs of joe daily. Plus it’s good looking and in my relatively small hand it’s comfortable and balanced. The added plus is no more little plastic pods to feel guilty about sending to the landfill.
customer_reviews.author: PDX Reader

customer_reviews.title: Excellent press from a coffee aficionado. Superb customer svc from seller
customer_reviews.text: I earlier posted a negative review but revising based on the outstanding custom service from the seller. Great product. I use it daily and will never go back to glass. Durable and a total work horse. Coffee tastes amazing
customer_reviews.author: Alex Palo Alto

customer_reviews.title: Worth the extra $$$$$
customer_reviews.text: Amazing. This is, hands down, the best french press I have used over the years. The double steel wall is great for keeping entire press cool to warm while steeping grounds. Serves 2.5 large mugs at a time with the 17 oz. Very easy to clean. To clean you do not need to take apart the entire plunger. You can simply unscrew it partially to create space between each layer and clean this way. Handle is perfectly designed to pour for someone with large or small hands. Was a little nervous to spend 500+ on a press but have not had a regret especially after first cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: jay

customer_reviews.title: Looks great - but a disappointment based on price
customer_reviews.text: I gave this French Press an honest chance because I really like the looks of it. However, the coffee that I made is not better than the coffee I make in my $20 glass French Press taste wise. I tried it with fine, medium, and course grinds and had just as much grinds and sludge at the bottom of my cup. It does stay hot longer. So to be honest, if you like the looks of this pot - great buy it. But don't think you will have a "cleaner" or better tasting cup of coffee than the other brands. Not worth the extra money in my kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: So I'm exchanging it hoping it will work like the first one
customer_reviews.text: I bought two - the smallest size. One for home and one for work, and one of them works perfectly, and the other has a short piston, so it always leaves some coffee below the strainer, which ends up in the drain. So I'm exchanging it hoping it will work like the first one. Otherwise it looks great - really cute, and it makes a very good coffee - after you'll figure out what coffee beans work the best for you, the grinding size, and the amount. It's very easy to use and clean. It makes about 6oz. of espresso type coffee. I like it with foamed Half & Half, and it tastes like a great cappuccino.
customer_reviews.author: Nadezda

customer_reviews.title: 600 perfect pots
customer_reviews.text: I just realized how long I've been using this French press and I think it deserves a review. After eleven years it looks and works like the day I bought it. Easy to use, easy to clean and makes a great brew.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas B. Iram

customer_reviews.title: VERY DISAPPOINTING!
customer_reviews.text: Had a Bodum (Eileen -170z) which was great but wanted to make a few ounces more and most importantly heard the insulated presses kept liquids hotter. Paid WAY TOO MUCH for this Frieling 23 oz. Did NOT take 6 ounces more than my Bodum because you can't fill beyond spout. Most importantly IT DID NOT KEEP MY COFFEE HOTTER A MINUTE LONGER THAN MY BODUM. Plus scraping of metal plunger against metal sides kind of irritating. Go with glass, go with Bodum.
customer_reviews.author: Robert McCullough

customer_reviews.title: Well made, beautiful, effective French Press Pot
customer_reviews.text: I use this product every day that I'm home. It's incredibly well-built and beautiful. It's probably the nicest thing in my kitchen. The double wall makes a big difference in keeping coffee hot compared to a single-wall of glass. The plunger was initially a little difficult to insert into the pot since the fit is so tight (to keep grounds from passing into the coffee), but after few uses it became much easier. If I were to do it again I would probably buy the size up from the 23oz. The 23oz makes about 2 full cups of coffee.
customer_reviews.author: PJT

customer_reviews.title: French Press of my dreams!
customer_reviews.text: Review is for the 36 oz version. If this helps anyone, please note that the coffee grounds will take up significant space inside the press if you like your coffee strong. I can make three 10 oz cups using 32 oz of water and 79 grams of coffee. Not quite as much as I wanted, but adequate for daily use. Moving on, this brewer make the best french press coffee I've ever tried! Sediment is very minimal, and the flavors really pop. It's easy to disassemble, clean, and put back together. None of the parts feel cheap and I'm confident it will last many years.
customer_reviews.author: aperfectopportunity

customer_reviews.title: Compact, durable
customer_reviews.text: This is my second French Press, the first having glass walls and a much flimsier plunger. This stainless steel French Press with zero sediment dual screen has been holding up nicely. I rinse the screens out and throw the grounds over the fence for my bushes. It may not be as quick as the Keurig, but it is arguably a better cup of coffee and less of an ecological footprint. Give it a try!
customer_reviews.author: KS

customer_reviews.title: A big improvement over glass presses
customer_reviews.text: I generally don't break that many dishes but I somehow managed to break two glass-carafe French presses in about a year. I was happy to find this all-metal one and it has not disappointed. It feels very sturdy and well-made, in particular the screen is really tight and doesn't let grounds through. The insulation is a great feature to since it keeps my coffee warmer. I don't know why glass French presses are the default, this is far superior.
customer_reviews.author: Hello World

customer_reviews.title: Previously had glass ones that were easy to break
customer_reviews.text: This is our first all stainless steel press. Previously had glass ones that were easy to break, but I doubt this is going to have any failures anytime soon. Welds all look clean and smooth. Definitely a sharp look and feels as good as it looks. If you like to pre-heat your press, do not submerge the plunger while doing so. It adds unnecessary wear to the device for ANY press... Not just this one. The fit is tight on this one (in a good way as it keeps grounds out) and it will be more difficult to extract until the press cools.
customer_reviews.author: Harold Gray

customer_reviews.title: Internal filtering system screw in broke off
customer_reviews.text: We really liked this French Press Coffee Maker. The coffee was great and it was easy to make and clean. However, while removing the internal filtering system the stem that screws in broke off a small section. We've only had the coffee maker for 6 months and only used it once a week. Able to still use the machine but it no longer filters out all sediment and grounds. Also there is nothing in the use manual on how to put everything together. Had to find that on YouTube.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Shermeyer

customer_reviews.title: The best French Press
customer_reviews.text: Going on one year of owning mine and I use it daily. I pour boiling water into my press with fresh ground coffee and set a timer for 6 minutes. When finished, I count to 30 seconds as I plunge the press. It makes the best tasting coffee. I rarely buy designer coffee-shop coffee anymore. Coffee stays hot for about an hour. Easy to disassemble, wash with soap/water for the next morning’s batch. Totally worth the investment.
customer_reviews.author: evh347

customer_reviews.title: Long Live King Coffee!!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! Wow! Wow! The first cup was fantastic...I got the 24 oz...made my first cup of pressed coffee today, and it was unbelievable, and that was with just some illy beans we had! I can't wait to get some really awesome beans and work this out right!! Smooth action on the plunge, it looks like a piece of art!! I'm hooked!! Pretty sure it won't be long before I purchase the big kahuna 44 oz Frieling press..I hemmed and hawed, and the negative reviews had me thinking maybe start with a cheap press, really glad I didn't!! This thing is awesome!!
customer_reviews.author: johnd66

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed for an almost $100 coffee press
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Completely stainless steel. Update: I spent more for this coffee maker than a cheaper one so I wouldn’t have the problems I’m having. Coffee grounds get stuck between the filter linings and it doesn’t sift through good at all– keeping out the coffee grounds at the bottom of the pot very well. Needless to say I’m disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn Carol Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely exquisite on every design feature!
customer_reviews.text: Top-of-the-line. The double-walled design ensures you'll never burn yourself if you forget to use the handle after you've poured boiling hot water in the pot. The polished steel is exquisite. I plan on having this until I'm called home. Then it will become a family heirloom. Thank you Frieling!
customer_reviews.author: Killer Bass Player

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful, functional, perfect
customer_reviews.text: Just got it, washed it out and made my first pot! (a) it is beautiful, (b) it feels very solid without being too heavy, (c) it really is 100% stainless there is no rubber or plastic anywhere I can tell. If you follow the very simple instructions (coarse grind, pre-heat, hot water, 4 minutes, push down slowly), you really can't go wrong. If you think you want it, get it. There's no hidden gotcha. I have a big guy hand, so I need to use a brush to clean it on the inside. As others have noted, it is not for long-term coffee storage while drinking. It is not insulated.
customer_reviews.author: Marc SantaCruz

customer_reviews.title: Like some features. Dislike sediment in cup
customer_reviews.text: What I like is it retains heat better than glass. What I don’t like is there is sediment in cup. I’m using pre ground bean which supposedly is the right grind for coffee. I’ll try grinding my own beans, coarser this time to see what happens. Too bad company doesn’t offer replacement screens.
customer_reviews.author: Chey

customer_reviews.title: Amazing quality
customer_reviews.text: Best french press I have owned. The coffee comes out soo smooth and not bitter. I have the 16 oz so that I can take it with me when I travel, I have to have a light weight item that can make amazing coffee....this is it! If you want a very good cup of coffee and a beautiful french press then this is for you. It is expensive but worth it. I also have a 32ox bodium and the quality of coffee made does not compare.
customer_reviews.author: Doctorlaw

customer_reviews.title: I've tried a lot of others, this is the best
customer_reviews.text: I'll bet I've gone through two dozen different kinds of French Presses and this is my favorite. For sure. Great coffee, solid construction, easy to clean, and attractive. I just took it apart for its first thorough cleaning and I smiled when I figured out how easily the filter parts came apart completely and went right back together (probably mentioned in the instructions!). I've had others that had permanent particles stuck in the filter assembly. Made in USA.
customer_reviews.author: J. Olsson

customer_reviews.title: Rust
customer_reviews.text: My husband was SO EXCITED to get this french press and swears that it makes the BEST coffee. Unfortunately, the top of the "stainless steel" lid has begun to rust. I thought stainless steel doesn't rust?!!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Kumar

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.text: I have a couple very expensive french press coffee makers that have a couple filters inside that eventually make pushing the grinds down almost impossible. I cleaned them with every product available and they still clog very quickly. The Frieling is perfect. The system is simple, works well and is a breeze to clean. Also gets all the coffee to the cup instead of having to throw some away with the grinds every time. Good purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Two Virginians

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Duty, High Quality and Brews a Great Cupa Joe
customer_reviews.text: This french press is built like a tank, heavy duty and well made. It reflects quality and takes super care of the problem of breaking glass pots that most french press coffee makers come with. I appreciate the two stainless mesh screens that seem to do a great job in filtering out sediment and coffee debris. Just brewed one pot of Joe and it is very good. I will update as needed but so far all is good, very good.
customer_reviews.author: Major T

customer_reviews.title: hits 9/10 of the qualities I want
customer_reviews.text: This coffee press is awesome! I love its feel in the hand, the pour, its sizing and the aesthetic of the metal. My only gripe is that my individual press is somewhat too tight when placed inside the brewer and it makes for a somewhat sporadic press down of the coffee. The metal from the filter needs to be filed down some or used over time to create a perfect fit. Besides that very minor design flaw, this coffee press is EXACTLY what I wanted! I am very happy :)
customer_reviews.author: Justin Mojgani

customer_reviews.title: Pleasure to use and have.
customer_reviews.text: Saw this French press in a high-end hotel bar and had to find out what brand it was. Never really liked my Bodrun press with its loose handle and rattle. This one, however, is a pleasure to use and a nice design to have on the countertop. Oh, and the coffee is delicious and stays hot all through Sunday breakfast.
customer_reviews.author: KathleenMcH

customer_reviews.title: Still the best french press
customer_reviews.text: Keeps drink warm longer than most thermo bottles after years of use. Solid construction with good workmanship and shiny, pretty appearance had friends rushed to buy it, except the pricing now is almost doubled what I paid.
customer_reviews.author: kuoch

customer_reviews.title: Made in China!
customer_reviews.text: I’m loving my French press! Makes excellent coffee...enough for two cups! Which is perfect for me. Only thing I don’t like is that it’s made in China.
customer_reviews.author: FancyPants

customer_reviews.title: I love the idea of this coffee press
customer_reviews.text: But it absolutely kills the flavor of coffee. I've tried changing water temperatures, water volumes, and amount of coffee and still can't match the taste of other coffee makers. I don't understand why this is this way. It also does not stay hot as long as I would expect a vacuum insulated device to maintain heat. Even after presoaking the coffee press with a fill of hot water it still cools more quickly than expected. Other than that, it's built like a tank, durable, and easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So Cool
customer_reviews.text: This is my second one as I also keep on in my RV, and I really enjoy that I can make enough for just myself and take it out on the porch or to my home office and enjoy my morning coffee. Simple, elegant and super easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: 8 years of flawless performance
customer_reviews.text: I've broken several glass french presses and tired of all my other coffee machinery. This Frieling press has not needed one part fixed, is used nearly daily, and add nothing to a landfill from breakage or single-use garbage. It is mistreated by my SO who leaves the plunger down in pressed coffee and leaves for work and pretty much never rinses it. No rust at all, does its job.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Sweet

customer_reviews.title: Gorgeous but not sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this beautiful Frieling coffee press a long time ago but continued to use my larger Bodum while my mother lived with me. She died recently and I decided I could use the smaller Frieling. After just a few months, the plunger broke. I ordered a replacement on the Frieling site for $6 - but Frieling charged me $9 to ship. The Frieling press is gorgeous but if you want a press that works consistently for years, I'd suggest the Bodum instead. Update: After I posted, Frieling agreed to charge me only $3.50 to ship the plunger. That's a far more reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Austinite

customer_reviews.title: Use every day for many years.
customer_reviews.text: We bought it as a gift, having very good and long experience with a similar coffee maker. If you want to clean filter, cleaning takes some time. Coffee taste is really good. Keeps heat long enough to serve coffee hot after 20-30 min. A good and durable construction. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: VMKM

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: the very best French press I have ever owned. Use it every day now. I have had numerous ways to make coffee for the past 30 years, but this is the absolute best. Grind fres cofeee every morning, pour hot water in, close lid, wait for 4 min. Meanwhile, pour milk in a gadget that makes foam, hit a button, and the coffee and foamed milk are available at the same time. Heat a big mug, pour in coffee, foam/milk and you have a cappuccino. Far better than a $1,000 expresso maker. taste great (buy dark roast coffee), and can't be simpler.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent French Press
customer_reviews.text: The quality of this French Press is outstanding! It is very high quality and brews outstanding coffee. I would have given it five stars if the thermal properties were just a little better. The coffee stays hot for a while and definitely long enough if more than one person is enjoying it. If you are making coffee for only one person, I would suggest you either purchase a smaller size or pour it into a thermal carafe.
customer_reviews.author: JT Moose

customer_reviews.title: damaged item
customer_reviews.text: unfortunately the item received was defective, specifically the filter attachment screws were rounded, thus unable to assemble completely.
customer_reviews.author: CP

customer_reviews.title: After 9 years of daily use it is still like new, worth every penny.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in 2011 after breaking several 'glass' presses. I was worried about dropping the money for it, after using it daily for 9 years, I feel qualified to say this press is worth every penny and is absolutely a must have for any serious coffee drinker/addict. Press is still like new after all this time. They can still make them like they used to, this is an example.
customer_reviews.author: GoofBoy

customer_reviews.title: The filter comes apart
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the French press and used less than a month and was realized that it is one week outside of the return window, I am very disappointed. the mesh portion of the filter completely separated from the rest part and cause coffee particles to get into my coffee. very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: guoqing gong

customer_reviews.title: Healthnut’s fave
customer_reviews.text: A perfect french press for people who don’t want any hot water coming in contact with any plastic or silicone! Also, the double wall helps coffee stay warmer mich longer. It is made of ONLY stainless steel
customer_reviews.author: HonestCustomer

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: I love french press coffee. After breaking multiple glass carraffes from multiple different brands (bodum, mr. coffee, etc) this is by far the best french press I have ever used. Besides having an all stainless-steel construction this looks really nice on the counter. it keeps your coffee hot much longer than glass. What really sets this apart though is the constuction of the plunger. Usually the spring wears out on the outside of cheaper models and lets stray grounds get into your cup; after constant daily use of over a year now, everything looks and feels like I just got it. I will never replace this french press as I don't foresee it wearing out any time soon.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Brooks

customer_reviews.title: Very Poor Delivery
customer_reviews.text: The actual item itself is fantastic! It is a beautiful stainless steel French press that makes amazing coffee. However the delivery was awful, not sure if this was a mistake but the French press was literally delivered in its actual single box. As seen from the picture the main press actual pushed through the box, it wasn’t damaged luckily but maybe a product to be bought in store.
customer_reviews.author: igor sokolan

customer_reviews.title: Solid stainless construction
customer_reviews.text: Double lined stainless steal holds the temperature so you can enjoy a hot 2nd and 3rd cup. Solid construction with a tight fit so that grounds don’t enter your coffee chamber.
customer_reviews.author: Mat and Rick

customer_reviews.title: Very nice looking, works very well, liquid stays hot.
customer_reviews.text: Love the new double wall stainless French Press. Keeps the coffee hot for a long period of time and makes a great cup of coffee. My espresso maker died so I tried this. Really pleased and there's no noise.
customer_reviews.author: Bettysharona

customer_reviews.title: Great for all ages!
customer_reviews.text: If my geriatric parents can use this use, then anyone can! They love its ease of use, plus the fact that they can make two cups' worth, so there's little waste.
customer_reviews.author: CGP

customer_reviews.title: Best French press I've ever owned.
customer_reviews.text: This French press is worth every penny. It's solidly built. The screens fit tightly to the interior walls, so no coffee grounds end up in my cup. My fiancé bought one for me. After using it for a short while, I bought one for him! I definitely think we will be using our Frieling French presses for many years to come.
customer_reviews.author: J.B.R.

customer_reviews.title: Lovely piece of equipment
customer_reviews.text: I bought the small one, which is just *barely* large enough for one small cup of coffee. The pot is very well constructed, a joy to hold in one's hand, very unlike most stuff made today.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Grayson

customer_reviews.title: quality design and product
customer_reviews.text: Great filter and looks like it'll last for a long time. Anticipate to buy a slightly larger size compared to your coffee mug/container; since you will not be filling it up all the way to the top.
customer_reviews.author: Viraltempo

customer_reviews.title: Rock Solid Quality Press!
customer_reviews.text: I switched from a Bodum thin glass press to this beast and have not looked back. It is heavy, well made and keeps pressed coffee hot till the last drop. ALL METAL construction is amazing and it is easy to clean. The only complaint I have is there is no lip on the lid to close off the pour spot. Sometimes when I plunge a full carafe some grinds and coffee will spurt out the pour spout. Heat can also escape easier from the unguarded pour spout. I've learned to pay more attention when plunging and will not deduct from my rating for this small complaint.
customer_reviews.author: DoubleA

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for my husband to use at work. Looked great on his desk and helped him make some great tasting coffee. Also makes a good gift!
customer_reviews.author: Courtney Noles

customer_reviews.title: So beautiful
customer_reviews.text: I love this!!! I've only used glass presses in the past. I've looked at this one longingly but passed because it was pricey. I finally decided it's cheaper than glass if you keep breaking the glass carafes. So glad I did. It's beautiful and makes me feel like I'm getting a special treat in the morning. The 23 ounce one makes two mugs of coffee (not actually 23 oz because you have to leave room at the top) and that is all I drink so this is perfect. The carafe keeps it hot enough that by the time I'm done with the first cup the second cup is still hot.
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: Last press you'll ever buy and never break
customer_reviews.text: After breaking the third glass beaker press, I did some research and found this. PERFECT! Makes amazing coffee without crumbling when I go to wash it. The double wall on this one also does a fairly good job of keeping the coffee hot while brewing. Be aware, it is not as big as you'd think from the description. It is the perfect size for two and a half typical mugs (not 6-8 oz cups) of coffee. It's also easy to clean and has no plastic whatsoever; it's all stainless and looks beautiful at the breakfast table. If you're not a coffee snob, you will become one after trying this... with good coffee, of course.
customer_reviews.author: STCWMan

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful appliance
customer_reviews.text: It was a gift, so I am not sure about the use. Was a beautiful appliance with great quality features. Sure they will be pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: nance

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful and functional
customer_reviews.text: I gave this as a gift and it is being used every day. The stainless looks wonderful no matter how often it's used. I opted to get this medium sized one which has been fine for several cups of coffee and fits easily under the upper cabinets. I assume that if you needed to make coffee for a crowd, you might want the larger size. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: S. Signore

customer_reviews.title: Well made, worth the investment, will last for years
customer_reviews.text: We got this french press after enjoying the smaller Frieling press (22oz?) for over 15 years. It seems to be just as well made (maybe even better since they added an extra screen to the press part). I expect this will last us for many years and make many delicious pots of coffee. The design is beautiful and very ascetically pleasing - a wonderful way to start your day. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda G

customer_reviews.title: Best French Press I've had!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best French Press coffee maker I have ever used. After breaking several glass units, I decided to try this sturdy stainless steel model. Now, after more than two years, I am very pleased to report that it is working as well as it did out of the box. The added feature of the double layer of steel helps to keep the coffee warm far longer than any glass model I've had. Last, I've received many many compliments on the design...it is always out on display in the kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: EdCon0055321

customer_reviews.title: Nice, solid French press
customer_reviews.text: Very well-built and easy to use. Perfect for travel mug size single serving which is what I was looking for. Fairly easy to clean. As others have stated does not really keep coffee hot for very long but this size is mainly single serve in my opinion so it doesn’t matter to me. I would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Len winkler

customer_reviews.title: Well Built and Long Lasting
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a tank compared to my old presses which, inevitably cracked. That's why I purchased this model, it was definately worth the extra $ since I feel it will last me years. It keeps coffee hot, like hot hot, longer than a glass press which is nice. It takes atleast 30 min to start losing its heat. One thing that I should caution is when pushing the plunger down initially, I have found it best to take caution against the backflow of water as it will shoot up the spout if the angle is just off. I've had one volcanic palm eruption which, taught me an important lesson! All in all, totally pleased with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Exie

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this French press for Christmas....best coffee press ever. With it being insulated, the coffee stays hot for an hour or so. I got the larger size as there are two of us and it's perfect to fill both our travel mugs in the morning. Very easy to keep clean as well. I would highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... warm up the container so your coffee does not cool down), this product is excellent
customer_reviews.text: Besides the pre-warm efforts required (putting some warm/hot water in it before putting the boilding water to warm up the container so your coffee does not cool down), this product is excellent. The filter, the design, the strudiness and the appearance (about which I don't much care) are awesome! I use this daily and am completely satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: James A. Freeman

customer_reviews.title: Keeping it hot
customer_reviews.text: Need to get information on how to clean meshed filters when necessary. Replacement parts ? Reassemble process. Really like the sleek design . If you heat container with boiling water, then empty when ready to add coffee & hot water , wow, stays hot for a good hour plus.
customer_reviews.author: Valzar

customer_reviews.title: Best Press Pot Ever!
customer_reviews.text: I received this press pot as a gift a few years back. Since then I ordered another one for camping. This pot hold up to everything! There is nothing like a great cup of coffee on a cold morning in the woods!
customer_reviews.author: D.Sibley

customer_reviews.title: works great, but broke within a year
customer_reviews.text: We loved this French Press, but a little less than 11 months into using it, a washer near the top came loose, broke, and now the lid is wobbly. I would hope a press at this price point would last at least a year. That said, this is our only complaint. it does a great job keeping grounds out of our drinks (even when we occasionally used fine ground beans).
customer_reviews.author: amk

customer_reviews.title: Useless filter
customer_reviews.text: The cup has a lot of coffee grinds that are not filtered out. I am using a "very coarse" grind still there is a lot of coffee residue. Disappointing especially given the price.
customer_reviews.author: zzman

customer_reviews.title: Keeps coffee hot but grounds get through
customer_reviews.text: We’ve loved French press coffee for years but have struggled with broken glass carafes so decided to try a ss one. Love how it keeps the coffee HOT much longer and carafe is easy to clean. The plunger does let grounds through every time. So have to spoon them out to it chew your coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Jdkbdkmom

customer_reviews.title: but the quality is much better than many of the others out there
customer_reviews.text: Yes, it's a bit pricey, but the quality is much better than many of the others out there. It really keeps the coffee hot. My parents commented on it when they saw it my kitchen and so I bought one for them. They love it too.
customer_reviews.author: T. Tan

customer_reviews.title: Looks Fancy!
customer_reviews.text: Great french press. I wish I had gotten the brushed steel instead of the stainless. I feel like the product description was a little deceptive but it doesnt matter now. I am using it daily and it makes a great cup of coffee. It keeps the coffee warm for quite awhile and is easy to clean up. I bought this to move away from using a Keurig Vue. I can never find the cups and when I do, they are expensive.
customer_reviews.author: jgoose

customer_reviews.title: Up your coffee game.
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this daily, sometimes multiple times a day for nearly 5 years and it doesn't look like it is failing anytime soon. My coffee making experience is so much better. Oh don't fill it too high or depress it too fast or it will spurt grinds and coffee out the little spout, but you will get the hang of it.
customer_reviews.author: christopher brennan

customer_reviews.title: Better than glass or plastic
customer_reviews.text: This is my first French press purchase. So far I'm very happy with it. The coffee tastes great, once you get the ratio of grounds to water all figured out. The insulated walls keep the second cup hot long enough to enjoy at a leisurely pace. The stainless steel looks nice and contemporary on the kitchen counter and takes up far less space than the old drip coffee maker. If you like making a couple of cups of coffee at a time, this is a great item. And while I don't plan on smashing it, I like the durability of stainless steel over yet another glass appliance.
customer_reviews.author: P. Menard

customer_reviews.title: Nice french press.
customer_reviews.text: Okay, it's necessary to spend a significant amount of money if one wants to have a good, plastic-free French Press. This is such an item. My only issue is that the screen is permanently riveted in, and thus harder to clean/replace versus some other models. I am just hoping that there is a replacement available for the top piece individually, should it wear out. The insulating function works fairly well. Nice ergonomics.
customer_reviews.author: ChaseBase

customer_reviews.title: Wow!
customer_reviews.text: I have used various french press coffee makers for years. My kitchen counter has 4 of them sitting next to the coffee grinder. I just made my first coffee with this new press, and I love it! It is beautiful, feels wonderful to handle and makes the BEST coffee ever. Before I finished my first cup I went back on line and ordered another one, the 32 ounce size. Our employees, 6 of them, make coffee in our kitchen all day. This is the new way. They will love it too. If you are thinking of buying one. Do it. You will not be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: SusanH

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Little Press!
customer_reviews.text: Never owning a Press before, and the positive reviews on Amazon I decided on the Frieling. It's perfect. For it's size it delivers about three mugs of coffee and the brew is unbelievable. The element allows the coffee to stay hot, but then again the coffee is so good it never lingers very long. I took suggestions from the reviews and made certain not to grind the coffee too fine - and wow! Delicious coffee every time. Not to mention the beautiful design and the hardy stainless steel Thanks to all the hints and tips it made this purchase tremendously worth the money. A big bang for the buck, I would absolutely recommend this to my friends.
customer_reviews.author: Terese A. Lindgren

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality.
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with this purchase. I decided on the largest one and I am glad I did. Enough for 4 - 6 servings, depending on the size of cup. Saw one reviewer who said product was flimsy or not well made and I could not disagree more. I am fussy and have found this to be of excellent quality.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Oh what Fun it is to Use!
customer_reviews.text: My 8 ounce size is not large enough to keep my coffee hot for very long. I could emerge the entire press in hot water to get a better result but I don't have that much patience.
customer_reviews.author: Theodore David Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: Great French Press
customer_reviews.text: DH and I drink espresso all the time. We never have brewed coffee. When my parents or some others come to visit they often want brewed coffee. I love the taste of pressed coffee but it gets cold too quickly. This solved all our problems. It holds about 3 cups of coffee (largish cups) and stays warm for at least an hour. Also, it does not appear to stain or hold fingerprints. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: ABThomasTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: it's time to get rid of the coffee drip machine.
customer_reviews.text: I'm a real coffee drinker. I'm the type that takes her coffee with her everywhere she goes. I've heard a lot about the french press and read a lot about it too. i finally decided on this due to its sleek look plus many of the reviews suggested were very useful. the cleaning is very simple. it certainly keeps your coffee hot for a while. so you can enjoy your 2nd and 3rd cup of coffee still. the preparation process is very simple and the end result is amazing. I will suggest you get an electric water boiler to speed up your process. my coffee is ready in 5 min at the most.
customer_reviews.author: Dareena

customer_reviews.title: Best new small appliance in the house
customer_reviews.text: This stainless steel beauty looks great and makes delicious coffee. Christmas gift for my no-nonsense husband. Wasn't sure he would be thrilled with the fuss. Has been using it everyday and even ran to the store as soon as he was almost out of coffee. We decided, in our suburban Chicago area, it was simpler to buy coarse ground coffee at whole foods or other local grocer rather than buy a grinder etc. Has worked out well. This is dishwasher safe and comes out sparkling without any discoloration. High quality stainless. Couldn't be happier with a cool gift that keeps on giving!
customer_reviews.author: Beth Strotman

customer_reviews.title: A new kind of coffee!!!
customer_reviews.text: I read a lot of reviews before deciding on this french press. I absolutely love it and have no complaints. My only suggestion would be to be making it in a larger size. Okay, Now Ive had this french press for 6 months and we use it almost daily. The outside finish is holding up very well. No scratches or marring of the finish. The plunger completely disassembles so you can thoroughly clean the screen. With the insulated walls the coffee does stay hot long enough for the second cup. Still would like for it to be bigger.
customer_reviews.author: Melinda Youngblood

customer_reviews.title: A beautiful French Press that is perfect for two small cups of coffee.
customer_reviews.text: Sleek, stylish , perfect for two small cups of French Press coffee. Easy to clean & well insulated. I love this French Press after using a glass one for over 40 years......
customer_reviews.author: Mary-Lou M.

customer_reviews.title: This is great for a lazy Saturday when I drink the entire ...
customer_reviews.text: Having owned, and broken, a few Bodum's with the glass beaker I decided it was time to get a french press with sturdier materials. This french press has double walls so the coffee stays HOT over the course of a few hours. This is great for a lazy Saturday when I drink the entire french press by myself whereas my old Bodum glass press would have been cold. I've used this with house guests and they have commented on the design. I expect this to outlast me.
customer_reviews.author: Chris from Chicago

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and well made
customer_reviews.text: I like the 17-ounce size as it makes about two cups and it is easy to handle compared to a larger one that it replaced. Pros +The filter does not leak ground +Any sediment that makes it through is directly attributed to the grind of the coffee Cons -Does not seal the container when steeping the coffee. The lip of the lid is not long enough to cover the opening of the spout.
customer_reviews.author: dash-o

customer_reviews.title: Tiny house must have for coffee drinkers!
customer_reviews.text: Keeps the brew hot without power! I tend to brew a pot in the morning and drink it over about 2 hours. 2nd cup decently hot, 3rd is less so, but far better than non-insulated French presses that are lukewarm for my 2nd cup and stone cold for the third. It cleans quickly and easily, with only a quick rinse. And it looks good! I'm slowly downsizing my kitchen preparing for an eventual move into a tiny house. And it looks nice enough to plan a spot to SHOW it (instead of planning a space to store it)!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: The best French Press coffee pot I've used.
customer_reviews.text: I love this coffee pot. I have broken both glass and plastic French Press coffee pots but I have used this one for over a year and it looks brand new. The double wall design keeps the coffee hot for a long time. Note: It is available in both brushed and polished finishes. I have the polished version and it has a mirror quality finish. The top of this pot also has a double wall design and it is sealed so that water will not get inside the top when you wash it.
customer_reviews.author: RAB

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great! Just be careful when pushing down the plunger, steady as she goes.
customer_reviews.author: TruthinAdvertising

customer_reviews.title: This is a very expensive plunger. The metal on ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a very expensive plunger. The metal on the side is sticking out however, and I have cut myself because of its sharp edge.
customer_reviews.author: Bluesoul33

customer_reviews.title: Attractive and functional
customer_reviews.text: We use this every day. LOVE it. So attractive and keeps the coffee warm for top offs
customer_reviews.author: Public name

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: I bought this one for my daughter. I have had the same Frieling French press for several years and I love it. I bought it after breaking a few glass ones, and it is worth the money. This French press is undestructible, it is easy to clean, and the double walls keep the coffee warm longer than glass ones. The stainless steel does not leach anything nasty in the hot water.The coffee is good, as one would expect from a French press.
customer_reviews.author: Jane

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality and easy to clean.
customer_reviews.text: I love this French Press!!! Its easy to use and clean and it makes me the perfect two cups I need to get going in the Mornings. The quality is top notch and I take it with me on any trip I have.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel E Salinas

customer_reviews.title: Gorgeous design and built solid
customer_reviews.text: After many years of broken glass beakers this Frieling press should pay for itself and then some. Very stylish and is built solidly (and it's pretty hefty for its size.) Screen and plunger mechanism are much heavier-duty than my previous Bodum glass presses and should stand-up as well. Looks great on my kitchen counter in my barista corner.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Presuto

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: No dripping, attractive and sturdy. Coffee stays hot until pot is empty.
customer_reviews.author: Susan D.

customer_reviews.title: Oh so pleased
customer_reviews.text: We love French press coffee but I broke each and every pot I bought. When the last one broke, I was ready to just give up. Then I saw this stainless steel press and I decided it was worth a try. Yes, it is beautiful but it is also easy to use and makes very good coffee. I grind the beans coarse, use very hot but not boiling water, wait four minutes, press slowly and voila. Filled up, it makes four mugs of coffee. I have never had grounds in the coffee or problems with boiling water bubbling out of the spout. I just wish it came in a larger size.
customer_reviews.author: R.Bridge

customer_reviews.title: Had it for 8 years...
customer_reviews.text: We have used this every day for the last eight years and it is still going strong. Very high quality! Love this- don't hesitate - it is perfection.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Nichols

customer_reviews.title: VERY pleased
customer_reviews.text: After I broke my 2nd glass carafe, my boyfriend suggested I get a stainless steel french press. I had no idea there even WAS such a thing. Thanks to google and amazon, I happened upon this little gem. This is the best little invention. It doesn't BREAK! As long as you preheat it with some hot water, the coffee doesn't get cold as quickly. I do this now with my stainless travel mug, too. I am careful to wash it separately so it doen't get scratched up. It's a lifetime piece so I want it to stay nice. This size is perfect for my 20 oz. travel mug, too.
customer_reviews.author: TMC

product_meta.title: Frieling USA Double-Walled Stainless-Steel French Press Coffee Maker, Brushed, 36 Ounces
feature_bullets: DUAL SCREEN ZERO SEDIMENT FILTER: The Frieling French Press Coffee Maker is designed to keep the coffee grounds out of your cup so you can enjoy delicious, smooth coffee with every pour. Thanks to the patented 2-stage filter system, you can enjoy the perfect cup of coffee with zero sediment.

DOUBLE-WALLED DESIGN: The double-wall design means that this coffee press will deliver hot coffee or tea for years to come. The insulated body and lid retain heat better than glass and stay hot up to 4 times longer. Also, the durable 18/10 stainless steel inside and out means no more broken glass or corrosion, and all parts are dishwasher safe.

ELEVATED COFFEE EXPERIENCE: Award winning and top-rated by countless magazines and coffee aficionados, the Frieling French Press Coffee Maker is a favorite in the best hotels and restaurants. This press delivers an easy to brew, full-bodied, consistently satisfying mug of coffee.

DIRECTIONS FOR USE: Add about 2 tbsp. of ground coffee to the French press for every cup of water you wish to brew. Adjust the amount of coffee to strengthen or weaken the flavor. Pour water that is slightly cooler than boiling into your French press. Stir, and cover with the lid. Allow coffee to brew for 4 minutes, stir again, and then press down on the plunger evenly and slowly. Your coffee is ready to pour and enjoy!

FRIELING: Since 1988, Frieling has specialized in fresh solutions. That means passionately developing and sourcing functional and well-designed products of the highest quality. The Frieling mission is to solve problems for our customers. Nobody wants to be sold yet another product; there are plenty already. Our daily goal is to offer a fresh solution to a problem.
